attributes.action: The DWP should cancel all face to face benefit appointments during the panedimc.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently we are living in uncertain and worrying times. A global panedimc of Covid-19.

I am a healthy person physically. However I am largely self isolating as a means of reducing the likelihood of spreading the virus. 

In the past for other reasons I have had a phone call appointment arranged and been able to email documents over. 

I have a benefits meeting next week and it seems absurd to me that the British government continues to send claimants, into meetings at the Jobcentre.
attributes.background:
To reduce the risk of spreading Covid-19 the government should move DWP meetings from face to face, to over the phone and internet. 

As it stands claimants must attend and sanctions are likely to apply.

rejection.details:
Since you started this petition, the Government has announced it has suspended jobcentre appointments. You can find out more here: https://www.gov.uk/government/news/coronavirus-support-for-employees-benefit-claimants-and-businesses

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here: 

NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/ 

UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
